data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet and assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains approximately 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and press releases concerning Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, aiming to more appropriately recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context by combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies.

Incorporates entity and sentiment annotations to address the challenge of headlines where sentiment may be conflicting, involving multiple entities. This dataset, consisting of over 10,700 human-annotated news headlines, provides insight into sentiment fluctuations dependent on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset containing tokenized and annotated transcripts of Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, minutes, and press conferences. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A dataset annotating relationships within financial documents, extracted from SEC 10-X filings, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relation types, spanning 8 entity pairs (e.g., Person-Job Title, Organization-Amount). Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.

A dataset collected from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines influence price fluctuations, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, supporting the identification and classification of financial entities within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset containing real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. It is annotated with high-level and low-level topics, promoting multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs involving detailed analysis of financial reports. Created by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data and provides training data for answering complex financial queries.
